titleStmt.title: Reasons humbly offered to the high court of Parliament against laying a duty of one peny [sic] per pound upon tann'd leather, setting forth the great inconveniencies that will arise, if the same should pass.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Hills, in Black-Fryers, near the Water-side.,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained and worn away, with loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
